channel.title: Client not connecting
channel.description: My client will not connect to my server, even through localhost. Any ideas? I'm need it to work for my 474 I'm creating.

item.title: Client not connecting
item.dc:creator: @madden538 madden538
item.description:
@madden538 wrote:

This is happening to me too i cant connect to my server from my other computer and i have all the ports and ips correct.

Read full topic

item.title: Client not connecting
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:17, topic:519679”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=638174.msg4301602#msg4301602 date=1369089512]

please check the uid
[/quote] ^ and any other type of encryption

AND make sure you aren’t banned o.o[/quote]
Turns out it is ny firewall. I cant even ping google lol. Now i got a bigger problem. See my post in server help xD

Read full topic

item.title: Client not connecting
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:12, topic:519679”][quote author=Redemtion link=topic=638174.msg4301542#msg4301542 date=1369083954]
And the login protocol server wise,

static { if(!Config.SERVER_DEBUG) { serverlistenerPort =43594; } else { serverlistenerPort = 43594; }
[/quote]that is nowhere close to being the login protocol. that’s the port initialization in the server class.[/quote]
Still the port and it doesn’t matter, and I told you already, it’s client sided because I’ve dealt with this before, I just forgot what I did to fix it.

m4x pwng3:

What client and what source? Some require coding to get to work with one another.

Came in a package, so no need.

Read full topic

item.title: Client not connecting
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Redemtion, post:11, topic:519679”]And the login protocol server wise,

static { if(!Config.SERVER_DEBUG) { serverlistenerPort =43594; } else { serverlistenerPort = 43594; }[/quote]that is nowhere close to being the login protocol. that’s the port initialization in the server class.

Read full topic

item.title: Client not connecting
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

Alright, now that I’m back on my computer here’s what my client port code looks like (which is correct)

And the login protocol server wise,

static { if(!Config.SERVER_DEBUG) { serverlistenerPort =43594; } else { serverlistenerPort = 43594; }

I have no idea what I did last time that made the client work. Other clients would be able to connect to the server but this specific client wont, and it’s the one I need. I’ll try messing around with my firewall a bit and see what I can change.

Read full topic

item.title: Client not connecting
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Redemtion, post:8, topic:519679”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=638174.msg4301372#msg4301372 date=1369064748]

say the server is running on port 43594.

it don’t matter if your client is connecting from localhost, an ipv4 address, or some external address across the world.

if the client is looking for the socket on a port that the server isn’t on, it will not connect

Localhost has no firewall, thus no port needs to be open…

Also I dont have uTorrent. I also have my own dedi server that I could try putting it on, but the problem is in the client.
[/quote]i never said opening the ports. the client opens sockets on a specific port

if the server is hosted on a different PORT_ID, the client will not connect

Not gonna argue but the server and the client are on the same port.[/quote]are you positive?

also, when trying to connect; does the server console out print anything?

check the login protocol on the server to see if there’s a uid check of any sort.

Read full topic
